intro: Hippolytia glomerata, commonly known as the clustered whipstick, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
